cardReading1Info: A practical guide to growing your UX design career.
cardReading2Info: Practice your product design and UX skills. Prepare for your next job interview.

cardReading8Info: The essential interaction design guide, fully revised and updated for the mobile age.

contactFormText: You can contact me through social networks or if you prefer, leave me a message and I will get back to you as soon as possible.
experienceCard1Description: Together with a team of designers and developers, I lead the UX and UI design of this project, in which we develop a mobile video game for iOS and Android platforms in an agile environment. I analyze market leaders offering similar products, research potential users and create low and high fidelity designs in Figma. I develop a prototype that allows me to verify design decisions through usability testing and A/B testing. We are now in the development phase and I collaborate with the development team to transition the prototype to React. Finally, I develop a design system that facilitates product maintenance and updates.
experienceCard1TechnologiesText: Figma - React - Adobe ilustrator - Microsoft azure - Miro
experienceCard1SkillsText: UX research - Wireframing - Prototyping - UX design - User test - UI design - Game design
experienceCard2Description: I was hired alongside a full-stack developer to design and develop a website for a travel agency. I conducted market research and analysis, focusing on users and competitors. I created low-fi and high-fi wireframes and conducted user tests, iterating on the designs based on the feedback received. I maintained clear communication with the development team to ensure effective implementation of the designs. Upon completion of the project, the company achieved branding and a website that increased its sales by over 200%.
experienceCard2TechnologiesText: Figma - Adobe photoshop - Miro - Hotjar - Google analytics
experienceCard2SkillsText: Ux research - UX design - UI design - Responsive web design - Mobile design - Web development
experienceCard3Description: As a freelancer, I was hired to design and develop a website for a visual effects studio. I researched the leading companies in the market and defined the product, creating user flows from low to high fidelity. I conducted user research and testing to ensure that the content and design were efficient. I developed the website, ensuring the final product met the expectations of both stakeholders and users. The company achieved a more than 50% increase in project bookings compared to the previous period.
experienceCard3TechnologiesText: Technologies: Figma - Adobe ilustrator - Wordpress - Google analytics
experienceCard3SkillsText: Ux research - UX design - UI design - Responsive web design - Mobile design - Web development
experienceCard4Description: As an employee at an industrial machinery manufacturing company, I was responsible for marketing and design tasks. I managed the design and development of the company's website and led SEO positioning campaigns. I spearheaded marketing campaigns on social media and organized and developed the design of various products necessary for the company's operations, including catalogs, advertisements, and documents. I also collaborated with stakeholders to organize the marketing and sales strategy.
experienceCard4TechnologiesText: Technologies: Google drive - Microsoft suite - Adobe ilustrator - Adobe Photoshop - Google analytics - Wordpress - Hotjar
experienceCard4SkillsText: Negotiation - Graphic design - SEO - Strategy - Digital marketing
cardEducation1Title: UI design patterns for successful software
cardEducation1Description: The efficiency of UI design patterns, emphasizing their selection, content organization for usability, and strategies for minimizing user effort.
cardEducation2Description: This course explores good design principles, emphasizing effective use of visual elements, color theory application, and the significance of typography and grid systems in improving design outcomes.
cardEducation3Title: Emotional design - How to make products people will love
cardEducation3Description: Emotion and design, how human factors affect, positive emotional experiences, what the “Triune brain” is and visceral & reflective design.
cardEducation4Description: Information visualization principles, effective techniques, and the interplay between the eye and the brain.
cardEducation5Title: Design for the 21st century with Don Norman
cardEducation5Description: How to solve global problems, how can we democratize design, how can we apply human-centered design and how can we move up in a company.
cardEducation6Description: Intuitive user experience, loyalty & business profitability and navigation & screen design.
cardEducation7Description: Interfaces móviles, experiencia de usuario móvil, UI (Android e IOS), cómo evitar un mal diseño y estrategia de diseño UX.
cardEducation8Title: Gestalt psychology and Web design:  The ultimate guide
cardEducation8Description: Mobile interfaces, mobile user experience, UI (android and IOS), how to avoid bad design and UX design strategy.
cardEducation9Title: User Research - Methods and best practices
cardEducation9Description: Consumers and business, UX design concepts, experience design, design sprints, UX research methods and biases in UX design.
cardEducation10Description: Qualitative user research, design process, validation & ethical sound, usability test & observation, how to deal with results and how to deal with clients, bosses & stakeholders.
cardEducation11Description: Flexbox & Grid layout, responsive design, animations & transitions, advanced selectors, CSS preposessors, CSS custom properties, transformations & transitions, filters & shadows, CSS grid systems and perfomance optimization.
cardEducation12Description: Data analysis and synthesis, organizational skills, communication, economic and business, interdisciplinary skills and critical capacity.
cardProjectPortfolioChallenge: Create a personal portfolio from scratch using Figma for design and VS Code for development.
cardProjectPortfolioRol: Designer and developer, in charge of UX/UI design and coding.
cardProjectPortfolioToolstack: Figma, HTML5, CSS3, Javascript and ChatGPT.
portfolioParagraph1Text: For this project, I will use a framework commonly employed for solving design problems. I will use Figma for the design aspect and HTML, CSS and JavaScript for development, along with ChatGPT for support. With all of this and with the goal of developing from scratch, a portfolio that will allow me to make my profile known.
portfolioParagraph2Text: This framework uses 6 steps to solve the problem: why, who, when and where, what, solve and how.
portfolioSubParagraph1Text: My professional profile is an opportunity to make myself known through the internet, positioning myself as a reference in the field of design, and allowing easy collaboration and contact with interested parties.
portfolioSubParagraph2Text: Which categories of people have significantly different motivations for using this portfolio?
cardTestimonial1PortfolioDescription: I need to find a qualified product designer to fill this vacant position.
cardTestimonial2PortfolioDescription: I am looking for a talented designer to collaborate with.
cardTestimonial3PortfolioDescription: I need to make sure that this candidate has the necessary skills.
cardInsight1Text: Users review portfolios when considering hiring, quickly looking for projects that demonstrate skills relevant to a specific position.
cardInsight2Text: It is displayed in offices, homes or on the move, usually on mobile or desktop devices, where accessibility and clarity are key.
cardInsight3Text: Users are looking for inspiration and reassurance, attracted by an intuitive, clear and aesthetically pleasing design that demonstrates the designer's competence.
portfolioSubParagraph4Text: The portfolio must show exceptional organization and clarity, ensuring ease of reading and understanding, allowing users to see what they have come to see and to be able to make contact quickly and easily.
portfolioSubParagraph5Text: I will use the following KPIs to measure the effectiveness of my portfolio.
portfolioParagraph3Text: Complete guidelines for maintaining visual and functional consistency of design.
portfolioSubParagraph6Text: Because of its modern look, legibility, ease of use, advantages for brand identity, accessibility and multilingual support, I decided to use Montserrat as the typeface for the portfolio.
portfolioSubParagraph7Text: Color palette for a consistent and attractive user experience.
portfolioSubParagraph8Text: Button styles and behaviors for clear and accessible actions.
portfolioSubParagraph9Text: Design of input fields for accurate and user-friendly interaction.
portfolioSubParagraph10Text: Guidelines for the representation and style of profile pictures.
portfolioSubParagraph11Text: Use and style of icons for an intuitive and visually clear interface.
portfolioSubParagraph12Text: Reusable component structure and design for a consistent experience and easily deployable and maintainable development.
portfolioParagraph4Text: Complete guidelines for maintaining visual and functional consistency of design.
someDesigns1Text: The user, when landing on the portfolio, must clearly understand what this website is, what he can do here and get an idea of my profile before continuing to navigate to any other place on the web. It must also have a clear navigation that allows them to move between the different pages.
someDesigns2Text: In the main page of the portfolio there are different sections that allow the user to see the tools I use, the skills that allow me to develop my work or some professional testimonials of people I have worked with.
someDesigns3Text: In this page you can see the developments of my latest works, as well as some of the most relevant certificates I have.
someDesigns4Text: As part of my learning and research work I develop a blog with articles where I delve into UX / UI design concepts.
portfolioParagraph5Text: With the creation of my portfolio from scratch, I have been able to learn how to develop a web project, with responsive design, both from the design and development side. This has allowed me to understand how to do my job as a designer in a way that can make the developer's job as easy as possible.
cardProjectSenzoStudioChallenge: Capture the creative essence of a VFX agency in a functional website, balancing visual complexity with usability.
cardProjectSenzoStudioRol: Designer and developer, in charge of UX/UI design and development.
senzoStudioParagraph1Text: I designed and developed a website for a VFX agency, starting with user research and competitive analysis. I then created a comprehensive information architecture and design system, resulting in a visually appealing website that showcases the agency's cutting-edge work and offers an intuitive user experience.
senzoStudioParagraph2Text: I start the project by conducting research. The goal is to thoroughly understand the type of user, competing companies, and the market in which the company operates.
senzoStudioSubParagraph1Text: After analyzing the type of user for Senzo Studio, I prepared the following questions.
senzoStudioSubParagraph2Text: After asking the questions to the two users, I extracted the following information.
senzoStudioSubParagraph5Text: These are some of Senzo studio's main competitors.
senzoStudioSubParagraph6Text: Identification of usability issues using recognized design principles.
senzoStudioSubParagraph7Text: Analysis of content to ensure relevance, clarity, and alignment with objectives.
senzoStudioSubParagraph8Text: Organizing information based on user logic and expectations.
senzoStudioParagraph3Text: These are some of the elements that are part of Senzo studio's design system.
senzoStudioSubParagraph9Text: I chose IBM Plex Sans for its readability and versatility, achieving a modern, professional design aligned with the project's identity.
senzoStudioSubParagraph10Text: Color palette for a consistent and attractive user experience.
senzoStudioSubParagraph11Text: As part of the design system, I developed the main components used in the project. Below, I present the 'card' component, utilized for the display of various projects.
cardQuestion1SenzoStudio: How do you anticipate using Senzo Studio's website in your professional workflow within the VFX industry?
cardQuestion2SenzoStudio: Can you describe specific tasks or activities for which you would rely on Senzo Studio's website to enhance your work?
cardQuestion3SenzoStudio: In your opinion, what are the key functionalities or features that a VFX studio's website should offer to cater to your needs effectively?
cardQuestion4SenzoStudio: What types of content or resources would you consider essential for a VFX studio's website to provide in order to be a valuable tool for professionals in the field?
cardQuestion5SenzoStudio: Considering your role and responsibilities in the VFX industry, what specific tools or functionalities do you believe should be easily accessible on the Senzo Studio website to streamline your tasks?
cardTestimonial1SenzoStudioDescription: As a VFX student, I see great potential in this website. I would appreciate a job offers section so I can apply for jobs here once I finish my studies.
cardTestimonial2SenzoStudioDescription: Having a section dedicated to showcasing your projects would greatly help us to consider potential collaborations and contracting opportunities.
senzoStudioParagraph5Text: This was my first project as a professional freelance. It was an excellent way to put into practice everything I was learning while simultaneously understanding the real needs of companies and users.
cardProjectAtipikoToursChallenge: Design and development of a travel agency website. The development was carried out by a back-end developer.
atipikoToursParagraph1Text: The project involves designing and developing a website from scratch that meets the needs of Atipiko Tours' clients and includes the content and elements necessary for the company to provide its services. Up until this point, the company did not have a digital presence.
atipikoToursParagraph2Text: With the research, I aim to address key questions such as who the user is, what their needs are, who the competitors are, and what they are doing.
atipikoToursSubParagraph1Text: Maria and Juan are two clients of Atipiko Tours. Following their analysis, the following results are presented.
atipikoToursSubParagraph2Text: I strive to understand how the user interacts with the product and what knowledge I can apply in the subsequent design.
atipikoToursSubParagraph3Text: These are some of Atipiko Tours' main competitors.
atipikoToursSubParagraph4Text: Identification of usability issues using recognized design principles.
atipikoToursSubParagraph5Text: Analysis of content to ensure relevance, clarity, and alignment with objectives.

atipikoToursNote2: The website should be easy to use.
atipikoToursNote3: I need to see customer reviews.
atipikoToursNote4: Is it safe to book here?
atipikoToursNote5: Am I getting the best price?

atipikoToursNote10: Anxiety about making the right choice.
atipikoToursNote11: Excitement about planning a perfect vacation.
atipikoToursNote18: The booking process should be quick.
atipikoToursNote19: Is there a deal within budget?
atipikoToursNote20: What will the quality be like?
atipikoToursNote21: I hope to compare options easily.
atipikoToursNote26: Concern about how the trip will go.
atipikoToursNote27: Satisfaction when finding the perfect deal.

atipikoToursParagraph5Text: This project allowed me to work closely with the project developer. Furthermore, it was a great experience to shape the ideas that the owners had but were unsure how to approach.
cardProjectTattooParadiseChallenge: Create an intuitive platform that connects users with artists and tattoo studios, facilitating the visualisation of styles and designs, and improving communication between both parties.
tattooParadiseParagraph1Text: The platform will allow users to explore a wide variety of styles and designs, making it easier to find the ideal tattoo artist according to their preferences. In addition, the app will offer a direct form of contact, improving the communication and experience for both artists and customers.
tattooParadiseParagraph2Text: Through an intuitive interface, users can browse a vast gallery of styles and designs, find tattoo artists that align with their aesthetic preferences and contact them directly and efficiently. For artists, the platform offers a unique opportunity for visibility, allowing them to showcase their work to a wider audience and connect with potential clients easily and effectively.
tattooParadiseParagraph3Text: In this investigation, I analyzed the market situation, conducted a study of the two main products available in the market, and examined the users through my own research.
tattooParadiseSubParagraph1Text: Fortune Business Insights conducted a study on the revenues generated by the sector over the past few years and provided a forecast for the next 10 years. The following data shows the size of the tattoo market in Europe and its forecast up to 2027 (USB Billion).
tattooParadiseSubParagraph2Text: What is the main problem you face when getting a tattoo?
tattooParadiseSubParagraph3Text: With the data obtained from the research, I create two user profiles.
tattooParadiseSubParagraph4Text: At the time of the project, the main products on the market were as follows.
tattooParadiseSubParagraph5Text: Identification of usability issues using recognized design principles.
tattooParadiseSubParagraph6Text: After analyzing the user and existing competitors in the market, I developed a prototype to conduct some tests and observe how real users interacted with it.
tattooParadiseCardTestimonial1Action2Tex: Search for studios and artists nearby
tattooParadiseCardTestimonial1Action3Tex: Open conversation with studies and artists
tattooParadiseCardTestimonial2Goal1Text: Guidelines on caring for a tattoo
tattooParadiseCardTestimonial2Goal2Text: Discover a variety of tattoo styles
tattooParadiseTable1Row2Header: Match between system and the real world
tattooParadisecardInsight1Text: Determine the feasibility of the tasks provided, including the number of clicks required for completion, execution time, and to gain a general understanding of how the user interacted with the product.
tattooParadisecardInsight2Text: I arranged a room for observing and recording the test, where the user, seated with the prototype in front, carried out the proposed tasks that were assigned.
tattooParadisecardInsight3Text: I selected 5 individuals, users from the tattoo industry with varying ages and levels of experience, for the observation and recording of the test.
tattooParadisecardInsight4Text: Access to study reviews, activate all notifications, access artist's designs, send a contact request, rate the app, access my conversations, delete my account, access tattoo styles, rate a design, access to care guide, log out.
tattooParadiseTable2Row1Header: Users encountered difficulty completing the delete account and logout tasks.
tattooParadiseTable2Row2Header: The user reported a spelling mistake in the submit button, in the task of rating the app.
tattooParadiseTable2Row3Header: The user thought they should be in settings instead of my profile.
tattooParadiseTable2Row4Header: A better context should be provided for the performance of the task 4.
tattooParadiseTable2Row5Header: The disconnection function is dispensable to the user.
tattooParadiseParagraph4Text: Elevating the tattoo experience, this product offers centralized knowledge, immersive style exploration, direct artistic connections, trend insights, and community engagement, redefining how users navigate and interact within the dynamic tattoo culture.
tattooParadiseSomeDesigns1Text: It is of vital importance that the product enables swift communication between users and artists. This will facilitate various types of interactions and open up different business opportunities.
tattooParadiseSomeDesigns2Text: The user has access to the different styles of tattoos, as well as to the designs associated with each one of them.
tattooParadiseSomeDesigns3Text: The user can access to the care and hygiene guide.
tattooParadiseSomeDesigns4Text: The product gives access to a variety of designs depending on different filters.
tattooParadiseParagraph5Text: I start the project by conducting research. The goal is to thoroughly understand the type of user, competing companies, and the market in which the company operates.
tattooParadiseSubParagraph7Text: Poppins has an international appeal and modern aesthetics, it ensures a positive user experience across diverse devices.
tattooParadiseSubParagraph8Text: Purple increases user engagement, highlights key elements and conveys creativity and modernity, making it ideal for prominent and dynamic mobile design.
tattooParadiseSubParagraph9Text: Below is the collection of icons used in this project.
tattooParadiseSubParagraph10Text: As part of the design system, I developed the main components used in the project. Below I present the “card” component, used for the visualization of the different tattoo styles.
tattooParadiseParagraph6Text: This was a project where I could conduct in-depth market research and had the opportunity to observe user behavior live. It particularly helped me learn how to empathize with the user, pinpoint where in the flow they get stuck, and understand the reasons behind it.
cardProjectGeomitesChallenge: Maintain visual and experiential coherence in the game, aligning the work of different disciplines and under a unified design vision.
cardProjectGeomitesToolstack: Figma, Adobe Ilustrator, Adobe Photoshop, Azure DevOps, Miro and DALL-E.
geomitesParagraph1Text: Geomites is a mobile strategy game available on both iOS and Android platforms. The game's core mechanics involve players managing a variety of characters, each with unique abilities and skills, which can be enhanced with items to improve their statistics.
geomitesSubParagraph1Text: Over the past year, I have been part of a dedicated team working to bring this project to life. As the Product Designer, my role encompassed the design of the user interfaces, guided by extensive market research into leading games. Players can level up these characters through two different game modes: online multiplayer battles against other players and an offline story mode that offers progressive challenges.
geomitesSubParagraph2Text: Our team utilized the Agile methodology to ensure a flexible and iterative development process. We structured our work into two-week sprints, each with clearly defined objectives.
geomitesSubParagraph3Text: Geomites is a talented and diverse team, with a single goal of bringing the project to market and making it accessible and enjoyable for as many users as possible.
geomitesParagraph2Text: At this point we reinforce the visual line and the coherence of the project.
geomitesSubParagraph4Text: The visual style of Geomites is characterized by vibrant colors, clean lines, and a cohesive aesthetic that appeals to our target audience. The objective in this point is defining the visual identity of Geomites, ensuring that every element—from characters to environments—was visually consistent and appealing.
geomitesSubParagraph5Text: We established a set of design guidelines to ensure uniformity across all user interfaces and game elements. These guidelines covered typography, color schemes, iconography, and layout structures. By adhering to these standards, we created a seamless user experience that felt intuitive and consistent, reinforcing the overall brand identity of Geomites.
geomitesParagraph3Text: Before I started making decisions affecting product design, I went to the market to see what some of the best companies and products that resemble the product Geomites offers were doing and how they were doing it.
geomitesSubParagraph6Text: To ensure Geomites stands out in the competitive mobile gaming market, we conducted an extensive benchmark study of some of the most successful games in the industry. By examining these popular titles, we identified key elements that contribute to their success, such as user engagement, visual design, and gameplay mechanics.
geomitesSubParagraph7Text: From our benchmark study, we extracted several design patterns that were consistently effective across the top games. For instance, the intuitive and user-friendly interfaces of Clash Royale and Brawl Stars highlighted the importance of clear navigation and accessible controls. Archero's engaging progression system and Shakes and Fidget's unique character customization options inspired us to incorporate similar elements into Geomites.
geomitesParagraph4Text: To ensure consistency and efficiency in our design process, we created a comprehensive Figma library. This library included all the design components, such as buttons, icons, color palettes, and typography styles. By using a centralized Figma library, we were able to maintain a cohesive look and feel across all game interfaces.
geomitesSubParagraph8Text: We chose the Greenze typeface to establish a consistent and visually appealing text style throughout Geomites. We chose this typeface for its legibility and compatibility with the adventurous theme of our game.
geomitesSubParagraph9Text: Our colour palette consists of ten colour families: neutral, red, orange, brown, brown, yellow, turquoise, green, violet, blue and pink. These colours have been carefully selected to evoke the adventurous atmosphere of the game and enhance the user interface elements.
geomitesSubParagraph10Text: The project required the icons to have a very good quality and an execution that would allow players to understand the meaning of the concepts they accompany, thus requiring excellent artistic execution.
geomitesSubParagraph11Text: The fortress building allows players to store both their geomites and the items and passives they equip. In this component I designed the building with different tabs and buttons that allow filtered searches.
geomitesSubParagraph12Text: For the implementation, we utilized Figma for design collaboration and React for development. Each sprint began with a review of design goals and priorities. Designs were created and validated using Figma, with input from team members Marc and Aleix. Once designs were finalized, Marc and Aleix led the development process in React, implementing the designs iteratively.
geomitesParagraph5Text: Here are some examples of final screens implemented by the development team.
geomitesParagraph6Text: Working on Geomites over the past year has been a great learning experience. This project has taught me a lot about game design and development. I also got to work closely with a talented team and learned from their skills and ideas. During this project, I improved my skills and learned new ones that will help me in future projects.
geomitesWorkMethodolody1: Evaluation of processes and current structure
geomitesWorkMethodolody3: Application design together with the team
geomitesSomeDesigns1Text: The first example showcases the 1 vs 1 battle interface in Geomites. This screen is designed to provide players with a clear and intuitive layout, ensuring they can easily manage their characters and engage in strategic combat.
geomitesSomeDesigns2Text: Where players can train their Geomites characters to improve their skills and abilities. This area of the game is designed to be both functional and visually appealing, offering players a sense of progression and achievement.
geomitesSomeDesigns3Text: Where players can exchange diamonds (real money) for essential resources needed for game progression. The store interface is designed to be user-friendly and visually engaging, encouraging players to make purchases.
geomitesSomeDesigns4Text: Which we use to provide game tips to players. This screen is designed to be informative and engaging, offering useful gameplay tips and tricks while the game loads.
